text: Who was the first man created by God?
verseText: Then the LORD God formed the man of dust from the ground and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life, and the man became a living creature. (ESV)

text: Who was the first woman created by God?
verseText: And the rib that the LORD God had taken from the man he made into a woman and brought her to the man. (ESV)

text: What was the sign of the covenant between God and Noah?
verseText: I have set my bow in the cloud, and it shall be a sign of the covenant between me and the earth. (ESV)

text: Who was the father of Ishmael?
verseText: And Hagar bore Abram a son, and Abram called the name of his son, whom Hagar bore, Ishmael. (ESV)

text: What was the name of the place where Jacob wrestled with God?
verseText: So Jacob called the name of the place Peniel, saying, 'For I have seen God face to face, and yet my life has been delivered.' (ESV)

text: What was the name of Abraham's second wife?
verseText: Abraham took another wife, whose name was Keturah. (ESV)

text: Who was the third son of Adam and Eve?
verseText: And Adam knew his wife again, and she bore a son and called his name Seth, for she said, 'God has appointed for me another offspring instead of Abel, for Cain killed him.' (ESV)

text: What did God create on the first day?
verseText: And God said, 'Let there be light,' and there was light. And God saw that the light was good. And God separated the light from the darkness. (ESV)

text: How many days did it take God to create everything according to Genesis?
verseText: And God saw everything that he had made, and behold, it was very good. And there was evening and there was morning, the sixth day. Thus the heavens and the earth were finished, and all the host of them. (ESV)

text: What did God make from Adam's rib?
verseText: And the rib that the LORD God had taken from the man he made into a woman and brought her to the man. (ESV)

text: Who killed Abel?
verseText: Cain spoke to Abel his brother. And when they were in the field, Cain rose up against his brother Abel and killed him. (ESV)

text: How old was Noah when the flood waters came?
verseText: Noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters came upon the earth. (ESV)

text: How many of each clean animal did Noah take on the ark?
verseText: Take with you seven pairs of all clean animals, the male and his mate, and a pair of the animals that are not clean, the male and his mate. (ESV)

text: What was the first bird Noah sent out from the ark?
verseText: and sent forth a raven. It went to and fro until the waters were dried up from the earth. (ESV)

text: Which of Noah's sons saw him naked and told his brothers?
verseText: And Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father and told his two brothers outside. (ESV)

text: How old was Abraham when Isaac was born?
verseText: Abraham was a hundred years old when his son Isaac was born to him. (ESV)

text: What relation was Lot to Abraham?
verseText: Now these are the generations of Terah. Terah fathered Abram, Nahor, and Haran; and Haran fathered Lot. (ESV)

text: What was Abraham's name before God changed it?
verseText: No longer shall your name be called Abram, but your name shall be Abraham, for I have made you the father of a multitude of nations. (ESV)

text: What city did Lot choose to live in?
verseText: Abram settled in the land of Canaan, while Lot settled among the cities of the valley and moved his tent as far as Sodom. (ESV)

text: Who was the father of Isaac?
verseText: And Sarah conceived and bore Abraham a son in his old age at the time of which God had spoken to him. Abraham called the name of his son who was born to him, whom Sarah bore him, Isaac. (ESV)

text: What was Jacob's twin brother's name?
verseText: When her days to give birth were completed, behold, there were twins in her womb. The first came out red, all his body like a hairy cloak, so they called his name Esau. Afterward his brother came out with his hand holding Esau's heel, so his name was called Jacob. (ESV)

text: For how many years did Jacob serve Laban to marry Rachel?
verseText: Jacob loved Rachel. And he said, 'I will serve you seven years for your younger daughter Rachel.' (ESV)

text: Who was Joseph's younger brother who shared the same mother?
verseText: The sons of Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin. (ESV)

text: What did Jacob give Joseph that made his brothers jealous?
verseText: Now Israel loved Joseph more than any other of his sons, because he was the son of his old age. And he made him a robe of many colors. (ESV)

text: What was Joseph's position in Egypt after interpreting Pharaoh's dream?
verseText: And Pharaoh said to Joseph, 'See, I have set you over all the land of Egypt.' (ESV)

text: What was the name of Isaac's wife?
verseText: Then Isaac brought her into the tent of Sarah his mother and took Rebekah, and she became his wife, and he loved her. So Isaac was comforted after his mother's death. (ESV)

text: How many years of plenty did Joseph predict would come to Egypt?
verseText: Behold, there come seven years of great plenty throughout all the land of Egypt. (ESV)

text: What did God tell Noah to build?
verseText: Make yourself an ark of gopher wood. Make rooms in the ark, and cover it inside and out with pitch. (ESV)

text: Who was the wife of Abraham?
verseText: And God said to Abraham, 'As for Sarai your wife, you shall not call her name Sarai, but Sarah shall be her name.' (ESV)

text: How many sons did Jacob have?
verseText: The sons of Jacob were twelve. (ESV)

text: What did Jacob give Esau in exchange for his birthright?
verseText: Then Jacob gave Esau bread and lentil stew, and he ate and drank and rose and went his way. Thus Esau despised his birthright. (ESV)

text: What fruit did Eve eat from the forbidden tree?
verseText: So when the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was a delight to the eyes, and that the tree was to be desired to make one wise, she took of its fruit and ate, and she also gave some to her husband who was with her, and he ate. (ESV)

text: What did God create on the sixth day?
verseText: And God said, 'Let the earth bring forth living creatures according to their kinds—livestock and creeping things and beasts of the earth according to their kinds.' And it was so... Then God said, 'Let us make man in our image, after our likeness.' (ESV)

text: What sign did God give Cain to protect him after he killed Abel?
verseText: Then the LORD said to him, 'Not so! If anyone kills Cain, vengeance shall be taken on him sevenfold.' And the LORD put a mark on Cain, lest any who found him should attack him. (ESV)

text: After the flood, on which mountains did Noah's ark rest?
verseText: And in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, the ark came to rest on the mountains of Ararat. (ESV)

text: Who was the father of Noah?
verseText: Lamech lived 182 years and had a son. He called his name Noah, saying, 'Out of the ground that the LORD has cursed, this one shall bring us relief from our work and from the painful toil of our hands.' (ESV)

text: Who was the oldest man recorded in Genesis?
verseText: Thus all the days of Methuselah were 969 years, and he died. (ESV)

text: Where did God confuse the language of the people building a tower to reach heaven?
verseText: Therefore its name was called Babel, because there the LORD confused the language of all the earth. And from there the LORD dispersed them over the face of all the earth. (ESV)

text: What was Sarah's name before God changed it?
verseText: And God said to Abraham, 'As for Sarai your wife, you shall not call her name Sarai, but Sarah shall be her name.' (ESV)

text: Who did Abraham meet after rescuing Lot?
verseText: And Melchizedek king of Salem brought out bread and wine. (He was priest of God Most High.) (ESV)

text: What was the name of Abraham's servant who was sent to find a wife for Isaac?
verseText: But Abram said, 'O Lord GOD, what will you give me, for I continue childless, and the heir of my house is Eliezer of Damascus?' (ESV)

text: What did Laban give to Jacob after he worked seven years for Rachel?
verseText: But in the evening he took his daughter Leah and brought her to Jacob, and he went in to her. (ESV)

text: What did Jacob see in his dream at Bethel?
verseText: And he dreamed, and behold, there was a ladder set up on the earth, and the top of it reached to heaven. And behold, the angels of God were ascending and descending on it! (ESV)

text: What new name did God give to Jacob?
verseText: Then he said, 'Your name shall no longer be called Jacob, but Israel, for you have striven with God and with men, and have prevailed.' (ESV)

text: What did Joseph's brothers do to him?
verseText: Then Midianite traders passed by. And they drew Joseph up and lifted him out of the pit, and sold him to the Ishmaelites for twenty shekels of silver. They took Joseph to Egypt. (ESV)

text: What position did Joseph hold in Potiphar's house?
verseText: So Joseph found favor in his sight and attended him, and he made him overseer of his house and put him in charge of all that he had. (ESV)

text: Who was Abraham's nephew?
verseText: Now these are the generations of Terah. Terah fathered Abram, Nahor, and Haran; and Haran fathered Lot. (ESV)

text: What was the name of the land where Abraham sojourned?
verseText: And Abram took Sarai his wife, and Lot his brother's son, and all their possessions that they had gathered, and the people that they had acquired in Haran, and they set out to go to the land of Canaan. (ESV)

text: What was Jacob doing when he first met Rachel?
verseText: Now as soon as Jacob saw Rachel the daughter of Laban his mother's brother, and the sheep of Laban his mother's brother, Jacob came near and rolled the stone from the well's mouth and watered the flock of Laban his mother's brother. (ESV)

text: What was the name of the Egyptian who bought Joseph from the traders?
verseText: Now Joseph had been brought down to Egypt, and Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh, the captain of the guard, an Egyptian, had bought him from the Ishmaelites who had brought him down there. (ESV)

text: How many clean birds did Noah take on the ark?
verseText: Also seven pairs of the birds of the heavens, male and female, to keep their offspring alive on the face of all the earth. (ESV)

text: What was the name of Abraham's first son?
verseText: And Hagar bore Abram a son, and Abram called the name of his son, whom Hagar bore, Ishmael. (ESV)

text: What was Joseph's Egyptian name given by Pharaoh?
verseText: And Pharaoh called Joseph's name Zaphenath-paneah. And he gave him in marriage Asenath, the daughter of Potiphera priest of On. So Joseph went out over the land of Egypt. (ESV)

text: What did Joseph store up during the seven years of plenty?
verseText: And Joseph stored up grain in great abundance, like the sand of the sea, until he ceased to measure it, for it could not be measured. (ESV)

text: What test did Abraham's servant use to identify a wife for Isaac?
verseText: Let the young woman to whom I shall say, 'Please let down your jar that I may drink,' and who shall say, 'Drink, and I will water your camels'—let her be the one whom you have appointed for your servant Isaac. (ESV)

text: What was the name of the mountain where Abraham was told to sacrifice Isaac?
verseText: He said, 'Take your son, your only son Isaac, whom you love, and go to the land of Moriah, and offer him there as a burnt offering on one of the mountains of which I shall tell you.' (ESV)

text: What did Joseph ask his brothers to bring from Canaan to prove they weren't spies?
verseText: And bring your youngest brother to me. So your words will be verified, and you shall not die.' And they did so. (ESV)

text: What did Jacob do to Laban's flocks to increase his wealth?
verseText: The flocks bred in front of the sticks and so the flocks brought forth striped, speckled, and spotted. And Jacob separated the lambs... Thus the man increased greatly and had large flocks, female servants and male servants, and camels and donkeys. (ESV)

text: What did Joseph hide in Benjamin's sack to frame him?
verseText: And put my cup, the silver cup, in the mouth of the sack of the youngest, with his money for the grain.' And he did as Joseph told him. (ESV)

text: Which of Jacob's sons suggested selling Joseph instead of killing him?
verseText: Then Judah said to his brothers, 'What profit is it if we kill our brother and conceal his blood? Come, let us sell him to the Ishmaelites, and let not our hand be upon him, for he is our brother, our own flesh.' And his brothers listened to him. (ESV)

text: How many people of Jacob's household went to Egypt?
verseText: And the sons of Joseph, who were born to him in Egypt, were two. All the persons of the house of Jacob who came into Egypt were seventy. (ESV)

text: What did the serpent say would happen if Eve ate from the forbidden tree?
verseText: For God knows that when you eat of it your eyes will be opened, and you will be like God, knowing good and evil. (ESV)

text: What type of tree was forbidden in the Garden of Eden?
options: Tree of knowledge of good and evil
verseText: But of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil you shall not eat, for in the day that you eat of it you shall surely die. (ESV)

text: What did God use to create Eve?
verseText: So the LORD God caused a deep sleep to fall upon the man, and while he slept took one of his ribs and closed up its place with flesh. And the rib that the LORD God had taken from the man he made into a woman and brought her to the man. (ESV)

text: Who found Joseph a wife in Egypt?
verseText: And Pharaoh called Joseph's name Zaphenath-paneah. And he gave him in marriage Asenath, the daughter of Potiphera priest of On. So Joseph went out over the land of Egypt. (ESV)

text: What animal spoke to Balaam?
verseText: Then the LORD opened the mouth of the donkey, and she said to Balaam, 'What have I done to you, that you have struck me these three times?' (ESV)

text: What happened to Lot's wife when she looked back at Sodom?
options: She became a pillar of salt
verseText: But Lot's wife, behind him, looked back, and she became a pillar of salt. (ESV)

text: In what land did Noah plant a vineyard after the flood?
verseText: Noah began to be a man of the soil, and he planted a vineyard. (ESV)

text: What was Abraham willing to sacrifice to God on Mount Moriah?
verseText: Then Abraham reached out his hand and took the knife to slaughter his son. (ESV)

text: What did the brothers put on Joseph's coat to deceive Jacob?
verseText: Then they took Joseph's robe and slaughtered a goat and dipped the robe in the blood. (ESV)

text: What was Joseph's first son's name?
verseText: Joseph called the name of the firstborn Manasseh. 'For,' he said, 'God has made me forget all my hardship and all my father's house.' (ESV)

text: What was the name of Abraham's servant who was sent to find a wife for Isaac?
verseText: And Abraham said to his servant, the oldest of his household, who had charge of all that he had... (ESV)

text: What did Jacob do all night at Peniel?
verseText: And Jacob was left alone. And a man wrestled with him until the breaking of the day. (ESV)

text: What was Enoch's relationship with God?
verseText: Enoch walked with God, and he was not, for God took him. (ESV)

text: Who was the father of Nimrod?
verseText: Cush fathered Nimrod; he was the first on earth to be a mighty man. (ESV)

text: What was the name of Isaac's elder son?
verseText: The first came out red, all his body like a hairy cloak, so they called his name Esau. (ESV)

text: What was the name of the place where Abraham's servant found Rebekah?
verseText: Then the servant took ten of his master's camels and departed, taking all sorts of choice gifts from his master; and he arose and went to Mesopotamia to the city of Nahor. (ESV)

text: What was Laban's relationship to Jacob?
verseText: Now as soon as Jacob saw Rachel the daughter of Laban his mother's brother... (ESV)

text: What did Joseph tell the baker his dream meant?
verseText: In three days Pharaoh will lift up your head—from you!—and hang you on a tree. And the birds will eat the flesh from you. (ESV)

text: What was the name of Esau's first wife?
verseText: When Esau was forty years old, he took Judith the daughter of Beeri the Hittite to be his wife, and Basemath the daughter of Elon the Hittite. (ESV)

text: What was Potiphar's position in Egypt?
verseText: Now Joseph had been brought down to Egypt, and Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh, the captain of the guard, an Egyptian, had bought him from the Ishmaelites who had brought him down there. (ESV)

text: Who was the mother of Ishmael?
verseText: And Hagar bore Abram a son, and Abram called the name of his son, whom Hagar bore, Ishmael. (ESV)

text: What was the name of the Canaanite woman who bore twins to Judah?
verseText: When the time of her labor came, there were twins in her womb. (ESV)

text: What was the name of Jacob's only daughter?
verseText: Afterward she bore a daughter and called her name Dinah. (ESV)

text: Who was the firstborn son of Jacob and Leah?
verseText: And Leah conceived and bore a son, and she called his name Reuben, for she said, 'Because the LORD has looked upon my affliction; for now my husband will love me.' (ESV)

text: Who was Cain's wife?
verseText: Cain knew his wife, and she conceived and bore Enoch. When he built a city, he called the name of the city after the name of his son, Enoch. (ESV)

text: What did Noah do after leaving the ark?
verseText: Then Noah built an altar to the LORD and took some of every clean animal and some of every clean bird and offered burnt offerings on the altar. (ESV)

text: What was Joseph's second son's name?
verseText: The name of the second he called Ephraim, 'For God has made me fruitful in the land of my affliction.' (ESV)

text: What was the name of the place where Jacob had his dream about the ladder?
verseText: He called the name of that place Bethel, but the name of the city was Luz at the first. (ESV)

text: What was the name of Seth's son?
verseText: To Seth also a son was born, and he called his name Enosh. At that time people began to call upon the name of the LORD. (ESV)

text: Where did Abraham's servant find Rebekah?
verseText: Before he had finished speaking, behold, Rebekah... came out with her water jar on her shoulder. (ESV)

text: Who was the King of Gerar who took Sarah into his harem?
verseText: And Abraham said of Sarah his wife, 'She is my sister.' And Abimelech king of Gerar sent and took Sarah. (ESV)

text: What was Lot's wife turned into when she looked back at Sodom?
verseText: But Lot's wife, behind him, looked back, and she became a pillar of salt. (ESV)

text: What was Rachel's maidservant's name?
verseText: Then she said, 'Here is my servant Bilhah; go in to her, that she may give birth on my behalf, that even I may have children through her.' (ESV)

text: Which son of Jacob was left as a guarantee in Egypt when the brothers first went to buy grain?
verseText: Then he turned away from them and wept. And he returned to them and spoke to them. And he took Simeon from them and bound him before their eyes. (ESV)

text: What was the name of Isaac's mother-in-law?
verseText: Before he had finished speaking, behold, Rebekah, who was born to Bethuel the son of Milcah, the wife of Nahor, Abraham's brother, came out with her water jar on her shoulder. (ESV)

text: What was the name of the cave Abraham purchased to bury Sarah?
verseText: After this, Abraham buried Sarah his wife in the cave of the field of Machpelah east of Mamre (that is, Hebron) in the land of Canaan. (ESV)

text: What was Leah's maidservant's name?
verseText: When Leah saw that she had ceased bearing children, she took her servant Zilpah and gave her to Jacob as a wife. (ESV)

text: What type of wood was Noah's ark made from?
verseText: Make yourself an ark of gopher wood. Make rooms in the ark, and cover it inside and out with pitch. (ESV)

text: Who was the father of Lamech?
verseText: When Methuselah had lived 187 years, he fathered Lamech. (ESV)

text: What was the name of the Egyptian woman who bore Ishmael to Abraham?
verseText: Now Sarai, Abram's wife, had borne him no children. She had a female Egyptian servant whose name was Hagar... And Hagar bore Abram a son, and Abram called the name of his son, whom Hagar bore, Ishmael. (ESV)

text: How long did the flood waters prevail upon the earth?
verseText: And the waters prevailed on the earth 150 days. (ESV)

text: What was the name of the wife of Joseph?
verseText: And Pharaoh called Joseph's name Zaphenath-paneah. And he gave him in marriage Asenath, the daughter of Potiphera priest of On. So Joseph went out over the land of Egypt. (ESV)

text: What did God create on the second day?
verseText: And God said, 'Let there be an expanse in the midst of the waters, and let it separate the waters from the waters.' ... And God called the expanse Heaven. And there was evening and there was morning, the second day. (ESV)

text: What did God create on the third day?
verseText: And God said, 'Let the waters under the heavens be gathered together into one place, and let the dry land appear.' ... And God said, 'Let the earth sprout vegetation, plants yielding seed, and fruit trees bearing fruit...' And there was evening and there was morning, the third day. (ESV)

text: What did God create on the fourth day?
verseText: And God said, 'Let there be lights in the expanse of the heavens to separate the day from the night.' ... And God made the two great lights—the greater light to rule the day and the lesser light to rule the night—and the stars. ... And there was evening and there was morning, the fourth day. (ESV)

text: What did God create on the fifth day?
verseText: And God said, 'Let the waters swarm with swarms of living creatures, and let birds fly above the earth across the expanse of the heavens.' ... And there was evening and there was morning, the fifth day. (ESV)

text: What did God do on the seventh day?
verseText: And on the seventh day God finished his work that he had done, and he rested on the seventh day from all his work that he had done. (ESV)

text: Where did God place the man he had formed?
verseText: And the LORD God planted a garden in Eden, in the east, and there he put the man whom he had formed. (ESV)

text: What was the name of the tree whose fruit Adam and Eve were forbidden to eat?
options: The tree of the knowledge of good and evil
verseText: but of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil you shall not eat, for in the day that you eat of it you shall surely die. (ESV)

text: What creature tempted Eve to eat the forbidden fruit?
verseText: Now the serpent was more crafty than any other beast of the field that the LORD God had made. He said to the woman, 'Did God actually say, "You shall not eat of any tree in the garden"?' (ESV)

text: What was Cain's occupation?
verseText: Now Abel was a keeper of sheep, and Cain a worker of the ground. (ESV)

text: What was Abel's occupation?
verseText: Now Abel was a keeper of sheep, and Cain a worker of the ground. (ESV)

text: Why was God pleased with Abel's offering but not Cain's?
options: Abel offered the firstborn of his flock
verseText: and Abel also brought of the firstborn of his flock and of their fat portions. And the LORD had regard for Abel and his offering, but for Cain and his offering he had no regard. (ESV)

text: Where did Cain go after killing Abel?
verseText: Then Cain went away from the presence of the LORD and settled in the land of Nod, east of Eden. (ESV)

text: How many of each kind of unclean animal did Noah take on the ark?
verseText: Take with you seven pairs of all clean animals, the male and his mate, and a pair of the animals that are not clean, the male and his mate. (ESV)

text: How long did it rain during the great flood?
verseText: And rain fell upon the earth forty days and forty nights. (ESV)

text: What bird did Noah send out that returned with an olive leaf?
verseText: And the dove came back to him in the evening, and behold, in her mouth was a freshly plucked olive leaf. So Noah knew that the waters had subsided from the earth. (ESV)

text: What did the people try to build at Babel?
verseText: Then they said, 'Come, let us build ourselves a city and a tower with its top in the heavens, and let us make a name for ourselves, lest we be dispersed over the face of the whole earth.' (ESV)

text: What did God promise Abraham concerning his descendants?
options: They would be as numerous as the stars
verseText: And he brought him outside and said, 'Look toward heaven, and number the stars, if you are able to number them.' Then he said to him, 'So shall your offspring be.' (ESV)

text: What did God destroy Sodom and Gomorrah with?
verseText: Then the LORD rained on Sodom and Gomorrah sulfur and fire from the LORD out of heaven. (ESV)

text: Who laughed when she heard she would have a son in her old age?
verseText: So Sarah laughed to herself, saying, 'After I am worn out, and my lord is old, shall I have pleasure?' (ESV)

text: What did Esau sell his birthright for?
verseText: Jacob said, 'Swear to me now.' So he swore to him and sold his birthright to Jacob. Then Jacob gave Esau bread and lentil stew, and he ate and drank and rose and went his way. Thus Esau despised his birthright. (ESV)

text: How did Jacob deceive his father Isaac to receive Esau's blessing?
options: Wore Esau's clothes and animal skins
verseText: Then Rebekah took the best garments of Esau her older son... and put them on Jacob her younger son. And the skins of the young goats she put on his hands and on the smooth part of his neck... So he went in to his father and said, 'My father.' And he said, 'Here I am. Who are you, my son?' Jacob said to his father, 'I am Esau your firstborn...' (ESV)

text: Who was Jacob's first wife?
verseText: But in the evening he took his daughter Leah and brought her to Jacob, and he went in to her. (ESV)

text: Which of Jacob's sons was sold into slavery by his brothers?
verseText: Then Midianite traders passed by. And they drew Joseph up and lifted him out of the pit, and sold him to the Ishmaelites for twenty shekels of silver. They took Joseph to Egypt. (ESV)

text: What ability did God give Joseph?
verseText: They said to him, 'We have had dreams, and there is no one to interpret them.' And Joseph said to them, 'Do not interpretations belong to God? Please tell them to me.' (ESV)

text: What did Pharaoh dream about that Joseph interpreted?
verseText: After two whole years, Pharaoh dreamed that he was standing by the Nile, and behold, there came up out of the Nile seven cows, attractive and plump... Then he fell asleep and dreamed a second time, and behold, seven ears of grain, plump and good, were growing on one stalk... Joseph said to Pharaoh, 'The dreams of Pharaoh are one; God has revealed to Pharaoh what he is about to do.' (ESV)

text: How many years of famine did Joseph predict?
verseText: then there will arise after them seven years of famine, and all the plenty will be forgotten in the land of Egypt. The famine will consume the land. (ESV)

text: Where did Jacob and his family settle in Egypt?
verseText: the land of Egypt is before you; settle your father and your brothers in the best of the land. Let them settle in the land of Goshen. (ESV)

text: Which son did Jacob bless more, Ephraim or Manasseh?
verseText: When Joseph saw that his father laid his right hand on the head of Ephraim, it displeased him... But his father refused and said, 'I know, my son, I know. He also shall become a people, and he also shall be great. Nevertheless, his younger brother shall be greater than he...' (ESV)

text: Where was Jacob buried?
verseText: For his sons carried him to the land of Canaan and buried him in the cave of the field of Machpelah, to the east of Mamre, which Abraham bought with the field from Ephron the Hittite to possess as a burying place. (ESV)

text: What were the names of the two trees specifically mentioned in the middle of the Garden of Eden?
options: Tree of life and Tree of knowledge of good and evil
verseText: And out of the ground the LORD God made to spring up every tree that is pleasant to the sight and good for food. The tree of life was in the midst of the garden, and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil. (ESV)

text: What were the names of the four rivers that flowed out of Eden?
verseText: A river flowed out of Eden to water the garden, and there it divided and became four rivers. The name of the first is the Pishon... The name of the second river is the Gihon... And the name of the third river is the Tigris... And the fourth river is the Euphrates. (ESV)

text: What material did God use to clothe Adam and Eve after they sinned?
verseText: And the LORD God made for Adam and for his wife garments of skins and clothed them. (ESV)

text: Who was the father of Enoch, the man who walked with God?
verseText: When Jared had lived 162 years, he fathered Enoch. (ESV)

text: Who were the 'Nephilim' mentioned before the flood?
options: Offspring of sons of God and daughters of men
All of the above interpretations exist
verseText: The Nephilim were on the earth in those days, and also afterward, when the sons of God came in to the daughters of man and they bore children to them. These were the mighty men who were of old, the men of renown. (ESV)

text: What were the dimensions of Noah's ark in cubits (length, width, height)?
verseText: This is how you are to make it: the length of the ark 300 cubits, its breadth 50 cubits, and its height 30 cubits. (ESV)

text: How many levels or decks did Noah's ark have?
verseText: Make a roof for the ark, and finish it to a cubit above, and set the door of the ark in its side. Make it with lower, second, and third decks. (ESV)

text: Who were Noah's three sons who were on the ark with him?
verseText: And Noah had three sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth. (ESV)

text: What did God promise never to do again after the flood?
options: Destroy all life with a flood
verseText: I establish my covenant with you, that never again shall all flesh be cut off by the waters of the flood, and never again shall there be a flood to destroy the earth. (ESV)

text: Which son of Noah was cursed because he saw his father's nakedness?
verseText: And Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father... When Noah awoke from his wine and knew what his youngest son had done to him, he said, 'Cursed be Canaan; a servant of servants shall he be to his brothers.' (ESV)

text: Who was Abraham's father?
verseText: When Terah had lived 70 years, he fathered Abram, Nahor, and Haran. (ESV)

text: From which city did God call Abram (Abraham) to leave?
verseText: Terah took Abram his son and Lot the son of Haran... and they went forth together from Ur of the Chaldees to go into the land of Canaan... Now the LORD said to Abram, 'Go from your country and your kindred and your father's house to the land that I will show you.' (ESV)

text: Why did Abram and Lot separate?
options: Their possessions were too great to dwell together
Lot wanted to live in the city
verseText: so that the land could not support both of them dwelling together; for their possessions were so great that they could not dwell together. (ESV)

text: Who rescued Lot after he was captured by the kings who attacked Sodom?
verseText: When Abram heard that his kinsman had been taken captive, he led forth his trained men... and went in pursuit as far as Dan... Then he brought back all the possessions, and also brought back his kinsman Lot with his possessions, and the women and the people. (ESV)

text: What did Melchizedek, king of Salem, give to Abram?
verseText: And Melchizedek king of Salem brought out bread and wine. (He was priest of God Most High.) (ESV)

text: What did Abram give to Melchizedek?
verseText: And blessed be God Most High, who has delivered your enemies into your hand!' And Abram gave him a tenth of everything. (ESV)

text: What physical sign of the covenant did God command Abraham and his descendants to practice?
verseText: This is my covenant, which you shall keep, between me and you and your offspring after you: Every male among you shall be circumcised. You shall be circumcised in the flesh of your foreskins, and it shall be a sign of the covenant between me and you. (ESV)

text: How many righteous people did Abraham initially ask God to find in Sodom to spare it?
verseText: Suppose there are fifty righteous within the city. Will you then sweep away the place and not spare it for the fifty righteous who are in it? (ESV)

text: What was the lowest number of righteous people Abraham negotiated for God to spare Sodom?
verseText: Then he said, 'Oh let not the Lord be angry, and I will speak again but this once. Suppose ten are found there.' He answered, 'For the sake of ten I will not destroy it.' (ESV)

text: Who warned Lot to flee Sodom?
verseText: The two angels came to Sodom in the evening... When morning dawned, the angels urged Lot, saying, 'Up! Take your wife and your two daughters who are here, lest you be swept away in the punishment of the city.' (ESV)

text: What did God provide as a substitute sacrifice for Isaac?
options: A ram caught in a thicket
verseText: And Abraham lifted up his eyes and looked, and behold, behind him was a ram, caught in a thicket by his horns. And Abraham went and took the ram and offered it up as a burnt offering instead of his son. (ESV)

text: Who did Abraham buy the cave of Machpelah from?
verseText: Abraham listened to Ephron, and Abraham weighed out for Ephron the silver that he had named in the hearing of the Hittites, four hundred shekels of silver... So the field of Ephron in Machpelah... became Abraham's property... (ESV)

text: What gifts did Abraham's servant give to Rebekah at the well?
options: A gold nose ring and two gold bracelets
verseText: When the camels had finished drinking, the man took a gold ring weighing a half shekel, and two bracelets for her arms weighing ten gold shekels. (ESV)

text: Who was Rebekah's brother?
verseText: Rebekah had a brother whose name was Laban. Laban ran out toward the man, to the spring. (ESV)

text: What physical characteristic distinguished Esau from Jacob at birth?
options: Esau was hairy, Jacob was smooth
verseText: The first came out red, all his body like a hairy cloak, so they called his name Esau. Afterward his brother came out with his hand holding Esau's heel, so his name was called Jacob. (ESV)

text: Where did Jacob flee to escape Esau's anger?
verseText: Now therefore, my son, obey my voice; arise, flee to Laban my brother in Haran... Then Isaac called Jacob and blessed him and directed him, 'You must not take a wife from the Canaanite women. Arise, go to Paddan-aram to the house of Bethuel your mother's father...' (ESV)

text: What did Jacob name the place where he dreamed of the ladder?
verseText: He called the name of that place Bethel, but the name of the city was Luz at the first. (ESV)

text: What object did Rachel steal from her father Laban when Jacob fled?
verseText: Laban had gone to shear his sheep, and Rachel stole her father's household gods. (ESV)

text: What injury did Jacob sustain while wrestling with the man at Peniel?
verseText: When the man saw that he did not prevail against Jacob, he touched his hip socket, and Jacob's hip was put out of joint as he wrestled with him. (ESV)

text: How did Jacob prepare to meet Esau after their long separation?
options: Divided his family and flocks into two groups
verseText: Then Jacob was greatly afraid and distressed. He divided the people who were with him, and the flocks and herds and camels, into two camps... And he prayed... Then he took from what he had with him a present for his brother Esau... (ESV)

text: Who defiled Dinah, Jacob's daughter?
verseText: Now Dinah the daughter of Leah, whom she had borne to Jacob, went out to see the women of the land. And when Shechem the son of Hamor the Hivite, the prince of the land, saw her, he seized her and lay with her and humiliated her. (ESV)

text: Which two sons of Jacob took revenge on the Shechemites for Dinah?
verseText: On the third day, when they were sore, two of the sons of Jacob, Simeon and Levi, Dinah's brothers, took their swords and came against the city unaware and killed all the males. (ESV)

text: Where did Rachel die and was buried?
verseText: So Rachel died, and she was buried on the way to Ephrath (that is, Bethlehem). (ESV)

text: Who was the cupbearer whose dream Joseph interpreted favorably in prison?
verseText: So the chief cupbearer told his dream to Joseph... Joseph said to him, 'This is its interpretation... in three days Pharaoh will lift up your head and restore you to your office...' He restored the chief cupbearer to his position... (ESV)

text: Who was the baker whose dream Joseph interpreted unfavorably in prison?
verseText: When the chief baker saw that the interpretation was favorable, he said to Joseph, 'I also had a dream...' Joseph answered and said, 'This is its interpretation... In three days Pharaoh will lift up your head—from you!—and hang you on a tree...' But he hanged the chief baker, as Joseph had interpreted to them. (ESV)

text: What did Joseph accuse his brothers of being when they first came to Egypt?
verseText: And Joseph remembered the dreams that he had dreamed of them. And he said to them, 'You are spies; you have come to see the nakedness of the land.' (ESV)

text: Which brother offered himself as a slave in Benjamin's place?
verseText: Now therefore, please let your servant remain instead of the boy as a servant to my lord, and let the boy go back with his brothers. (ESV)

text: What blessing did Jacob give Judah concerning leadership?
options: The scepter shall not depart from Judah
He would be the high priest
He would have the most land
verseText: The scepter shall not depart from Judah, nor the ruler's staff from between his feet, until tribute comes to him; and to him shall be the obedience of the peoples. (ESV)

text: What did Joseph make his brothers promise regarding his bones?
options: To carry them out of Egypt to Canaan
To scatter them in the Nile
verseText: Then Joseph made the sons of Israel swear, saying, 'God will surely visit you, and you shall carry up my bones from here.' (ESV)

text: How old was Joseph when he died?
verseText: So Joseph died at the age of 110 years. They embalmed him, and he was put in a coffin in Egypt. (ESV)

text: What does the name 'Adam' mean?
verseText: then the LORD God formed the man ('adam') of dust from the ground ('adamah') and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life, and the man became a living creature. (ESV)

text: What does the name 'Eve' mean?
verseText: The man called his wife's name Eve (Chavvah), because she was the mother of all living (chay). (ESV)

text: Who was the first person recorded as practicing polygamy in the Bible?
verseText: And Lamech took two wives. The name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah. (ESV)

text: Who were the sons of Lamech known for inventing musical instruments and metalworking?
verseText: His brother's name was Jubal; he was the father of all those who play the lyre and pipe. Zillah also bore Tubal-cain; he was the forger of all instruments of bronze and iron. (ESV)

text: How old was Adam when Seth was born?
verseText: When Adam had lived 130 years, he fathered a son in his own likeness, after his image, and named him Seth. (ESV)

text: How old was Adam when he died?
verseText: Thus all the days that Adam lived were 930 years, and he died. (ESV)

text: How old was Enoch when God took him?
verseText: Thus all the days of Enoch were 365 years. Enoch walked with God, and he was not, for God took him. (ESV)

text: What does the name 'Noah' mean?
verseText: He called his name Noah (Noach), saying, 'Out of the ground that the LORD has cursed, this one shall bring us relief (yenachamenu) from our work and from the painful toil of our hands.' (ESV)

text: Besides Noah and his family, how many people survived the flood?
verseText: He blotted out every living thing that was on the face of the ground, man and animals and creeping things and birds of the heavens. They were blotted out from the earth. Only Noah was left, and those who were with him in the ark. (ESV)

text: Who is listed as the ancestor of the Babylonians, Assyrians, and Arameans?
verseText: To Shem also, the father of all the children of Eber... The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, and Aram... (ESV)

text: Who is listed as the ancestor of the Egyptians, Philistines, and Canaanites?
verseText: The sons of Ham: Cush, Egypt (Mizraim), Put, and Canaan... Canaan fathered Sidon his firstborn and Heth... (ESV)

text: Who was Abraham's brother whose son was Lot?
verseText: Now these are the generations of Terah. Terah fathered Abram, Nahor, and Haran; and Haran fathered Lot. (ESV)

text: Who was Nahor's wife (Abraham's sister-in-law)?
verseText: And Abram and Nahor took wives. The name of Abram's wife was Sarai, and the name of Nahor's wife, Milcah, the daughter of Haran the father of Milcah and Iscah. (ESV)

text: What lie did Abraham tell about Sarah twice (to Pharaoh and Abimelech)?
verseText: Say you are my sister, that it may go well with me because of you... And Abraham said of Sarah his wife, 'She is my sister.' And Abimelech king of Gerar sent and took Sarah. (ESV)

text: What prophecy did God give Abraham about his descendants' time in Egypt?
options: They would be afflicted for 400 years
verseText: Then the LORD said to Abram, 'Know for certain that your offspring will be sojourners in a land that is not theirs and will be servants there, and they will be afflicted for four hundred years.' (ESV)

text: What does the name 'Ishmael' mean?
verseText: The angel of the LORD also said to her, 'Behold, you are pregnant and shall bear a son. You shall call his name Ishmael (Yishma'el), because the LORD has listened (shama') to your affliction.' (ESV)

text: What does the name 'Isaac' mean?
verseText: And Sarah said, 'God has made laughter (tsechoq) for me; everyone who hears will laugh (yitschaq-li) over me.' (ESV)

text: Where did Hagar and Ishmael go after being sent away by Abraham?
verseText: So Abraham rose early in the morning and took bread and a skin of water and gave it to Hagar... and sent her away. And she departed and wandered in the wilderness of Beersheba. (ESV)

text: What does 'Beersheba' mean, the place where Abraham made a treaty with Abimelech?
verseText: Therefore that place was called Beersheba (Be'er Sheva'), because there both of them swore an oath (nishbe'u). (Sheva also means seven, referring to the seven ewe lambs in v. 28-30). (ESV)

text: What does Abraham name the place where he was about to sacrifice Isaac?
verseText: So Abraham called the name of that place, 'The LORD will provide' (Yahweh-Yireh); as it is said to this day, 'On the mount of the LORD it shall be provided.' (ESV)

text: How old was Sarah when she died?
verseText: Sarah lived 127 years; these were the years of the life of Sarah. (ESV)

text: Who was Rebekah's father?
verseText: Before he had finished speaking, behold, Rebekah, who was born to Bethuel the son of Milcah, the wife of Nahor, Abraham's brother, came out... (ESV)

text: How old was Abraham when he died?
verseText: These are the days of the years of Abraham's life, 175 years. (ESV)

text: Who buried Abraham, and where?
options: Isaac and Ishmael in the cave of Machpelah
verseText: Isaac and Ishmael his sons buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron the son of Zohar the Hittite, east of Mamre. (ESV)

text: How old was Isaac when he married Rebekah?
verseText: and Isaac was forty years old when he took Rebekah to be his wife, the daughter of Bethuel the Aramean of Paddan-aram, the sister of Laban the Aramean. (ESV)

text: How old was Isaac when Jacob and Esau were born?
verseText: Afterward his brother came out with his hand holding Esau's heel, so his name was called Jacob. Isaac was sixty years old when she bore them. (ESV)

text: What does the name 'Jacob' mean?
verseText: Afterward his brother came out with his hand holding Esau's heel ('aqeb'), so his name was called Jacob (Ya'aqob)... Esau said, 'Is he not rightly named Jacob? For he has cheated (ya'qebeni') me these two times.' (ESV)

text: What does the name 'Esau' likely relate to?
verseText: The first came out red ('admoni'), all his body like a hairy ('se'ar') cloak, so they called his name Esau ('Esav'). (ESV)

text: Who were Esau's Hittite wives that grieved Isaac and Rebekah?
verseText: When Esau was forty years old, he took Judith the daughter of Beeri the Hittite to be his wife, and Basemath the daughter of Elon the Hittite, and they made life bitter for Isaac and Rebekah. (ESV)

text: What vow did Jacob make at Bethel after his dream?
options: To give God a tenth of all he received
verseText: Then Jacob made a vow, saying, 'If God will be with me... then the LORD shall be my God, and this stone, which I have set up for a pillar, shall be God's house. And of all that you give me I will give a full tenth to you.' (ESV)

text: What physical characteristic made Leah less favored by Jacob than Rachel?
verseText: Leah's eyes were weak, but Rachel was beautiful in form and appearance. (ESV)

text: What did Rachel give Leah in exchange for a night with Jacob?
verseText: In the days of wheat harvest Reuben went and found mandrakes in the field and brought them to his mother Leah. Then Rachel said to Leah, 'Please give me some of your son's mandrakes.' ... Rachel said, 'Then he may lie with you tonight in exchange for your son's mandrakes.' (ESV)

text: What does the name 'Israel' mean?
options: All of the above interpretations exist
verseText: Then he said, 'Your name shall no longer be called Jacob, but Israel (Yisra'el), for you have striven (sarita') with God ('Elohim') and with men, and have prevailed.' (ESV)

text: How many men did Esau bring with him when he came to meet Jacob?
verseText: And the messengers returned to Jacob, saying, 'We came to your brother Esau, and he is coming to meet you, and there are four hundred men with him.' (ESV)

text: Who was Rebekah's nurse who died and was buried near Bethel?
verseText: And Deborah, Rebekah's nurse, died, and she was buried under an oak below Bethel. So he called its name Allon-bacuth (Oak of Weeping). (ESV)

text: Which of Jacob's sons slept with Bilhah, Jacob's concubine?
verseText: While Israel lived in that land, Reuben went and lay with Bilhah his father's concubine. And Israel heard of it. (ESV)

text: How old was Isaac when he died?
verseText: Now the days of Isaac were 180 years. (ESV)

text: Who buried Isaac?
verseText: And Isaac breathed his last, and he died and was gathered to his people, old and full of days. And his sons Esau and Jacob buried him. (ESV)

text: What is another name for Esau, mentioned frequently in his genealogies?
verseText: These are the generations of Esau (that is, Edom). (ESV)

text: Who was Tamar, and who were her twin sons by Judah?
verseText: And Judah took a wife for Er his firstborn, and her name was Tamar... When the time of her labor came, there were twins in her womb... So his name was called Perez... Afterward his brother came out... So his name was called Zerah. (ESV)

text: What accusation did Potiphar's wife make against Joseph?
options: He tried to lie with her
verseText: she called to the men of her household and said to them, 'See, he has brought among us a Hebrew to laugh at us. He came in to me to lie with me, and I cried out with a loud voice.' ... Then she told him the same story, saying, 'The Hebrew servant, whom you have brought among us, came in to me to laugh at me.' (ESV)

text: How long was Joseph in prison after interpreting the cupbearer's dream before being remembered?
verseText: Yet the chief cupbearer did not remember Joseph, but forgot him. After two whole years, Pharaoh dreamed... (ESV)

text: How old was Joseph when he stood before Pharaoh?
verseText: Joseph was thirty years old when he entered the service of Pharaoh king of Egypt. (ESV)

text: Who was Joseph's wife, the mother of Manasseh and Ephraim?
verseText: And Pharaoh called Joseph's name Zaphenath-paneah. And he gave him in marriage Asenath, the daughter of Potiphera priest of On. (ESV)

text: What percentage of produce did Joseph require the Egyptians to give Pharaoh during the famine?
verseText: And at the harvests you shall give a fifth to Pharaoh, and four fifths shall be your own... (ESV)

text: How old was Jacob when he came to Egypt?
verseText: And Jacob said to Pharaoh, 'The days of the years of my sojourning are 130 years. Few and evil have been the days of the years of my life...' (ESV)

text: How long did Jacob live in Egypt before he died?
verseText: And Jacob lived in the land of Egypt seventeen years. So the days of Jacob, the years of his life, were 147 years. (ESV)

text: How long did the Egyptians mourn for Jacob?
verseText: Forty days were required for it, for that is how many are required for embalming. And the Egyptians wept for him seventy days. (ESV)
